definition: to consider oneself to be (sth positive)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou

sentences.english: So then the self-proclaimed Fire Song Dynasty, Zhao Germany .
sentences.chinese: 於是趙宋王朝便自命爲火德。

sentences.english: He sets himself up as an authority on art.
sentences.chinese: 他自命爲藝術方面的權威。

sentences.english: Always thought that to understand a lot of their own, chat all day, pretend to be thou.
sentences.chinese: 總以爲自己懂很多，整天談天說地，自命清高。

sentences.english: His loftiness sends him into despair when deprived of his job.
sentences.chinese: 他的自命清高使他在下崗後陷入絕望的境地。

sentences.english: He likes to set himself up as an intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡自命爲知識分子。

sentences.english: He fancies himself as the fastest swimmer .
sentences.chinese: 他自命爲游泳最快的人。

sentences.english: The smart and charming women are self-glorification.
sentences.chinese: 聰明又漂亮的女孩自命不凡。

sentences.english: He constituted himself their chief adviser.
sentences.chinese: 他自命爲他們的首席顧問。

sentences.english: Sometimes I even quarrel with them and do something which displeases them.
sentences.chinese: 有時我甚至與他們爭吵和做一些自命不凡。

sentences.english: We like seeing Mickey teaching the snootier characters some gritty life lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜歡看見米奇教訓那些自命不凡的角色。

sentences.english: A portentous soufflé that never truly rises.
sentences.chinese: 一部自命不凡的雜湊，不可能真正成功。

sentences.english: Kennedy handled the firestorm of outrage with self-defeating smugness.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪用自我拆臺的自命不凡來對付憤怒的烈火。

sentences.english: Between Zhongyong and Xingzimingchu, there're also many similarities.
sentences.chinese: 《中庸》和《性自命出》篇也非常相似。

sentences.english: Hotshot Eddie needed money to buy a new guitar.
sentences.chinese: 自命不凡的埃迪需要錢買把新吉他。

sentences.english: Her conceit deluded her into believing she was important.
sentences.chinese: 她的自負誘使她相信是自命不凡的。

sentences.english: A snobby person, Dr. Lee thinks some patients ignorant and stupid.
sentences.chinese: 自命不凡的李醫師，覺得一些病人無知和愚蠢。

definition: to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to view oneself
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to consider oneself as/to believe oneself to be
self-esteem/self-reliance/overconfident/conceited
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
pedantic/trite/inflexible/adherence to old ideas
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
arrogant and conceited
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
presumptuous and ignorant person
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
hypocrisy/pretended righteousness
